subject: Ethics
title: Animal Testing Morality
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Animal Testing Morality.

hook.text: A new cancer drug could save thousands of lives. But first, 200 mice must suffer and die to test it.

buildup.text: Over 100 million animals are used in research annually. Many endure pain, isolation, and death.

discovery.text: The 3Rs frameworkâ€”Replace, Reduce, Refineâ€”tries to minimize animal use while advancing science.

twist.text: 90% of drugs that pass animal tests fail in humans. The moral cost may not even produce reliable results.

climax.text: Organ-on-a-chip and AI models offer alternatives, but regulators still require animal data for approval.

punchline.text: We harm animals for cures that often don't work anyway.

quiz.question: What does the 3Rs framework for animal testing stand for?
